Text: How long, O LORD? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?
Context: David is feeling abandoned and is questioning God's presence in his time of distress.

Text: How long must I wrestle with my thoughts, and every day have sorrow in my heart? How long will my enemy triumph over me?
Context: David is expressing frustration and sorrow, indicating an ongoing battle with his own thoughts and perceived victories of his enemies.

Text: Look on me and answer, O LORD my God. Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep in death.
Context: David pleads for God's attention and help, fearing death or defeat without God's intervention.

Text: And my enemy will say, "I have overcome him," and my foes will rejoice when I fall.
Context: David is concerned about his enemies boasting of their victory which would happen if God does not intervene.

Text: But I have trusted in Your loving devotion; my heart rejoices in Your salvation.
Context: David reaffirms his trust in God and finds joy in his salvation despite the circumstances.

Text: I will sing to the LORD, for He has been good to me.
Context: David ends the Psalm with a note of thanksgiving and worship, reflecting his trust in God's goodness and faithfulness.
